question.title: Dynamically Selecting Certificate Chain and Private Key in Apache Camel AS2 Server
question.body:
I am building an AS2-based data transfer system using Apache Camel's AS2 component. My system needs to support multiple clients, where each client:

Uses a unique signing certificate chain, encrypts data with a different key (which is exchanged in advance).

Use Case

When an AS2 request arrives at my server, I need to:

Identify the sender based on the incoming request.
Dynamically select the appropriate validating certificate chain for signature verification.
Dynamically choose the decryption private key to decrypt the message.

Issue

From my exploration, it seems Apache Camel AS2 does not provide a built-in mechanism to dynamically attach these certificates and keys per sender.

Server Config

String methodName = AS2ServerManagerApiMethod.LISTEN.getName();
AS2ApiName as2ApiNameServer = AS2ApiName.SERVER;

AS2Configuration endpointConfiguration = new AS2Configuration();
endpointConfiguration.setApiName(as2ApiNameServer);
endpointConfiguration.setMethodName(methodName);
endpointConfiguration.setAs2MessageStructure(AS2MessageStructure.PLAIN);
endpointConfiguration.setMdnMessageTemplate(MDN_MESSAGE_TEMPLATE);
endpointConfiguration.setServer("My AS2 Server Endpoint");

// Need to dynamically set these based on sender identity
// endpointConfiguration.setValidatingCertificateChain(......);
// endpointConfiguration.setDecryptingPrivateKey(.......);

try (AS2Component as2Component = new AS2Component()) {
    as2Component.setCamelContext(camelContext);
    as2Component.setConfiguration(endpointConfiguration);
    return as2Component.createEndpoint(String.format(RECEIVE_URI, serverPortNumber, requestUriPattern));
}

Question

How can I extract the senderâ€™s identity from an incoming AS2 request within Apache Camel AS2?
Is there a way to dynamically assign the validating certificate chain and decryption key based on the sender?
If not, are there any workarounds or recommended approaches to achieve this behavior? Any insights or guidance would be greatly appreciated! ðŸš€
